subject: Communication
title: Positions vs. Interests
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Positions vs. Interests.

hook.text: Two sisters fight over the last orange. They cut it in half. One eats the fruit, the other uses the peel for baking.

buildup.text: Their positions were identical (I want the orange), but their interests were different (fruit vs. peel).

discovery.text: Fisher and Ury's 'Getting to Yes' taught: always negotiate interests, not positions.

twist.text: Interests are why they want it. Two people demanding the same office might want sunlight vs. quiet â€” both achievable.

climax.text: Most conflicts dissolve when you stop arguing about what and start asking why.

punchline.text: Don't fight over the orange. Ask why they want it.

quiz.question: What book introduced the positions vs. interests framework?
